title: Authors and Citation
text: Mowinckel (2026). ggseg.formats: Utility package ggseg-packages. R package version 0.0.1.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ggseg.formats: Utility package for the ggseg-packages},   author = {Athanasia Mo Mowinckel},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.0.1}, }

title: Utility package for the ggseg-packages
text: goal ggseg.formats provide S3 methods etc ggseg-universe. users deal package directly way.

title: Utility package for the ggseg-packages
text: recommend installing development version {ggseg.formats} ggseg r-universe. can also install development version ggseg.formats GitHub :
code: # Enable this universe options(repos = c(     ggseg = 'https://ggseg.r-universe.dev',     CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))  # Install some packages install.packages('ggseg.formats') # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ggseg/ggseg.formats")

what: FreeSurfer Automatic Subcortical Segmentation Atlas — aseg
title: FreeSurfer Automatic Subcortical Segmentation Atlas — aseg
text: Brain atlas FreeSurfer's automatic subcortical segmentation (aseg), containing deep brain structures including thalamus, caudate, putamen, pallidum, hippocampus, amygdala, accumbens, ventricles.

title: FreeSurfer Automatic Subcortical Segmentation Atlas — aseg
FreeSurfer Automatic Subcortical Segmentation Atlas — aseg
text: brain_atlas object components: atlas Character. Atlas name ("aseg") type Character. Atlas type ("subcortical") palette Named character vector colours region data subcortical_data object containing: meshes Data frame label mesh columns sf Simple features data frame 2D rendering

title: FreeSurfer Automatic Subcortical Segmentation Atlas — aseg
text: atlas derived FreeSurfer's aseg.mgz volumetric segmentation. works ggseg (2D slice views) ggseg3d (3D mesh visualizations) single object.

title: FreeSurfer Automatic Subcortical Segmentation Atlas — aseg
text: atlas contains bilateral structures: Thalamus Caudate Putamen Pallidum (globus pallidus) Hippocampus Amygdala Accumbens (nucleus accumbens) Ventral diencephalon Plus midline ventricular structures: Lateral ventricles Third ventricle Fourth ventricle Brain stem Cerebellar cortex Cerebellar white matter

title: FreeSurfer Automatic Subcortical Segmentation Atlas — aseg
code: # 2D plot with ggseg library(ggseg) plot(aseg)  # 3D plot with ggseg3d library(ggseg3d) ggseg3d(atlas = aseg, hemisphere = "subcort") |>   add_glassbrain()

title: FreeSurfer Automatic Subcortical Segmentation Atlas — aseg
text: Fischl B, Salat DH, Busa E, et al. (2002). Whole brain segmentation: automated labeling neuroanatomical structures human brain. Neuron, 33(3):341-355. doi:10.1016/S0896-6273(02)00569-X

title: FreeSurfer Automatic Subcortical Segmentation Atlas — aseg
code: data(aseg) aseg #>  #> ── aseg ggseg atlas ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Type: subcortical #> Regions: 18 #> Hemispheres: right, left, midline #> Views: coronal, sagittal #> Palette: ✔ #> Rendering: ✔ ggseg #> ✔ ggseg3d (meshes) #> ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> # A tibble: 29 × 3 #>    hemi  region            label                   #>    <chr> <chr>             <chr>                   #>  1 right NA                NA                      #>  2 left  NA                NA                      #>  3 left  thalamus proper   Left-Thalamus-Proper    #>  4 right thalamus proper   Right-Thalamus-Proper   #>  5 right lateral ventricle Right-Lateral-Ventricle #>  6 left  hippocampus       Left-Hippocampus        #>  7 left  lateral ventricle Left-Lateral-Ventricle  #>  8 right putamen           Right-Putamen           #>  9 right amygdala          Right-Amygdala          #> 10 left  putamen           Left-Putamen            #> # ℹ 19 more rows  # List regions brain_regions(aseg) #>  [1] "3rd ventricle"           "4th ventricle"           #>  [3] "CC anterior"             "CC central"              #>  [5] "CC mid anterior"         "CC mid posterior"        #>  [7] "CC posterior"            "amygdala"                #>  [9] "brain stem"              "caudate"                 #> [11] "cerebellum cortex"       "cerebellum white matter" #> [13] "hippocampus"             "lateral ventricle"       #> [15] "pallidum"                "putamen"                 #> [17] "thalamus proper"         "ventral DC"

Constructor for brain atlas — brain_atlas
text: Creates object class 'brain_atlas' plotting brain parcellations using ggseg (2D) ggseg3d (3D).

title: Constructor for brain atlas — brain_atlas
code: brain_atlas(atlas, type, palette = NULL, core, data)

title: Constructor for brain atlas — brain_atlas
text: atlas atlas short name, length one type atlas type: "cortical", "subcortical", "tract" palette named character vector colours keyed label core data.frame required columns hemi, region, label (one row per unique region). May contain additional columns grouping metadata (e.g., lobe, network, Brodmann area). data brain_atlas_data object created one : cortical_data(), subcortical_data(), tract_data(). Must match specified type.

title: Constructor for brain atlas — brain_atlas
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Cortical atlas atlas <- brain_atlas(   atlas = "dk",   type = "cortical",   core = core_df,   data = cortical_data(sf = geometry, vertices = vertex_indices) )  # Tract atlas atlas <- brain_atlas(   atlas = "hcp_tracts",   type = "tract",   core = core_df,   data = tract_data(meshes = tube_meshes, scalars = list(FA = fa_values)) ) } # }

code: brain_regions(x)  # S3 method for class 'ggseg_atlas' brain_regions(x)  # S3 method for class 'brain_atlas' brain_regions(x)  # S3 method for class 'data.frame' brain_regions(x)

Extract unique names of brain regions — brain_regions

what: Convert legacy brain_atlas to unified format — convert_legacy_brain_atlas
title: Convert legacy brain_atlas to unified format — convert_legacy_brain_atlas
text: Converts old-style brain_atlas ($data contains sf directly) unified format $core $data (brain_atlas_data).

title: Convert legacy brain_atlas to unified format — convert_legacy_brain_atlas
Convert legacy brain_atlas to unified format — convert_legacy_brain_atlas
Convert legacy brain_atlas to unified format — convert_legacy_brain_atlas
Convert legacy brain_atlas structure — convert_legacy_structure
text: Converts brain_atlas separate sf/vertices/meshes fields new structure single data field.

title: Create cortical atlas data — cortical_data
text: Creates data object cortical brain atlases. Cortical atlases use vertex indices map regions vertices shared brain surface mesh (e.g., fsaverage5).

title: Create cortical atlas data — cortical_data
text: sf sf data.frame columns label, view, geometry 2D rendering. Optional required ggseg plotting. vertices data.frame columns label vertices (list-column integer vectors). vector contains vertex indices region.

title: Create cortical atlas data — cortical_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data <- cortical_data(   sf = sf_geometry,   vertices = data.frame(     label = c("bankssts", "caudalanteriorcingulate"),     vertices = I(list(c(1, 2, 3), c(4, 5, 6)))   ) ) } # }

title: Desikan-Killiany Cortical Atlas — dk
text: Brain atlas Desikan-Killiany cortical parcellation 34 regions per hemisphere (68 total) cortical surface.

title: Desikan-Killiany Cortical Atlas — dk
text: brain_atlas object components: atlas Character. Atlas name ("dk") type Character. Atlas type ("cortical") palette Named character vector colours region data cortical_data object containing: vertices Data frame label vertices columns sf Simple features data frame 2D rendering

title: Desikan-Killiany Cortical Atlas — dk
text: atlas based FreeSurfer aparc annotation one widely used cortical parcellations neuroimaging research. atlas works ggseg (2D polygon plots) ggseg3d (3D mesh visualizations) single object.

title: Desikan-Killiany Cortical Atlas — dk
text: atlas contains 34 regions per hemisphere including: banks superior temporal sulcus, caudal anterior cingulate, caudal middle frontal, cuneus, entorhinal, fusiform, inferior parietal, inferior temporal, isthmus cingulate, lateral occipital, lateral orbitofrontal, lingual, medial orbitofrontal, middle temporal, parahippocampal, paracentral, pars opercularis, pars orbitalis, pars triangularis, pericalcarine, postcentral, posterior cingulate, precentral, precuneus, rostral anterior cingulate, rostral middle frontal, superior frontal, superior parietal, superior temporal, supramarginal, frontal pole, temporal pole, transverse temporal, insula.

title: Desikan-Killiany Cortical Atlas — dk
code: # 2D plot with ggseg library(ggseg) plot(dk)  # 3D plot with ggseg3d library(ggseg3d) ggseg3d(atlas = dk)

title: Desikan-Killiany Cortical Atlas — dk
text: Desikan RS, Ségonne F, Fischl B, et al. (2006). automated labeling system subdividing human cerebral cortex MRI scans gyral based regions interest. NeuroImage, 31(3):968-980. doi:10.1016/j.neuroimage.2006.01.021 Fischl B, van der Kouwe , Destrieux C, et al. (2004). Automatically parcellating human cerebral cortex. Cerebral Cortex, 14(1):11-22. doi:10.1093/cercor/bhg087

title: Desikan-Killiany Cortical Atlas — dk
code: data(dk) dk #>  #> ── dk ggseg atlas ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Type: cortical #> Regions: 35 #> Hemispheres: left, right #> Views: lateral, medial #> Palette: ✔ #> Rendering: ✔ ggseg #> ✔ ggseg3d (vertices) #> ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> # A tibble: 90 × 3 #>    hemi  region                label                   #>    <chr> <chr>                 <chr>                   #>  1 left  NA                    lh_unknown              #>  2 left  bankssts              lh_bankssts             #>  3 left  caudal middle frontal lh_caudalmiddlefrontal  #>  4 left  fusiform              lh_fusiform             #>  5 left  inferior parietal     lh_inferiorparietal     #>  6 left  inferior temporal     lh_inferiortemporal     #>  7 left  lateral occipital     lh_lateraloccipital     #>  8 left  lateral orbitofrontal lh_lateralorbitofrontal #>  9 left  middle temporal       lh_middletemporal       #> 10 left  pars opercularis      lh_parsopercularis      #> # ℹ 80 more rows  # List regions brain_regions(dk) #>  [1] "bankssts"                   "caudal anterior cingulate"  #>  [3] "caudal middle frontal"      "corpus callosum"            #>  [5] "cuneus"                     "entorhinal"                 #>  [7] "frontal pole"               "fusiform"                   #>  [9] "inferior parietal"          "inferior temporal"          #> [11] "insula"                     "isthmus cingulate"          #> [13] "lateral occipital"          "lateral orbitofrontal"      #> [15] "lingual" orbitalis"             "pars triangularis"          #> [23] "pericalcarine"              "postcentral"                #> [25] "posterior cingulate"        "precentral"                 #> [27] "precuneus"                  "rostral anterior cingulate" #> [29] "rostral middle frontal"     "superior frontal"           #> [31] "superior parietal"          "superior temporal"          #> [33] Create subcortical atlas data — subcortical_data
text: Creates data object subcortical brain atlases. Subcortical atlases use individual 3D meshes structure (e.g., hippocampus, amygdala).

title: Create subcortical atlas data — subcortical_data
text: sf sf data.frame columns label, view, geometry 2D rendering. Optional. meshes data.frame columns label mesh (list-column). mesh list : vertices: data.frame x, y, z columns faces: data.frame , j, k columns (1-based triangle indices)

title: Create subcortical atlas data — subcortical_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data <- subcortical_data(   meshes = data.frame(     label = "hippocampus_left",     mesh = I(list(list(       vertices = data.frame(x = 1:10, y = 1:10, z = 1:10),       faces = data.frame(i = 1:3, j = 2:4, k = 3:5)     )))   ) ) } # }

title: Create tract atlas data — tract_data
text: Creates data object white matter tract atlases. Tract atlases use tube meshes generated streamline centerlines.

title: Create tract atlas data — tract_data
text: sf sf data.frame columns label, view, geometry 2D rendering. Optional. meshes data.frame columns label mesh (list-column). mesh list : vertices: data.frame x, y, z columns faces: data.frame , j, k columns metadata: list n_centerline_points, centerline, tangents (required orientation coloring data projection)
